tool.name: CRISPR Studio
tool.description: facilitate and accelerate CRISPR array visualization from a GFF3 file generated with CRISPRDetect
tool.command:
ln -s '${input_data}' ./infile &&
#if $rerun.r == '-r': ln -s '${rerun.prev_final}' infile.fasta_fasta36.spacermatch.mcl.final && ln -s '${rerun.prev_svg}' infile.fasta_fasta36.spacermatch.mcl.svg && #end if
CRISPR_Studio
#if $adv.isolate_list: -l '${adv.isolate_list}' #end if
#if not $adv.isolate_list: #if $adv.s: -s '${adv.s}' #end if #end if
$f $adv.n $gU $gS $rerun.r
#if $cut_off: -c '${cut_off}' #end if
-i ./infile

param.name: isolate_list
param.label: List of Isolates to show
param.help: Generate the figure with the subset of isolates listed in the file

param.label: The order of the isolates in the figure
param.help: The order of the isolates in the figure: Available option: CRISPRDetect, DistMatrix or File providing a list of the isolates in the desired order. CRISPRDetect = order in the gff file. DistMatrix = Order extracted from a distance matrix based on the similarity of the arrays in the isolates. File = Order privided in a single column file with the isolates names as the should appear in the figure. The option list of Isolates to show will override this option (Default: DistMatrix)

param.label: Show the size of the spacers over the boxed diamonds?
param.help: We recommend to use this option only for experimental analysis of the data

param.label: Skip the verification of the fasta file generated from the GFF file?
param.help: The verification is mainly based on the length of the spacer sequences. If a spacer is 1.5 time shorter or longer than the average spacer size of the dataset, a warning is raised and the script stops (Verification is ran by default).

param.name: cut_off
param.label: Score cutoff for pairing of the spacers
Gray out unique?
param.help: The unique spacers will be grayed

param.label: Gray out similar?
param.help: The conserved spacers will be grayed

param.label: Change spacer colour?
param.help: Use this option to keep the same color attributed to the spacer during a previous analysis

param.name: prev_final
param.label: Previous spacer.mcl.final
param.help: Input a previous .final file you want to retain the colour from

param.name: prev_svg
param.label: Previous SVG
param.help: Input a previous .svg file you want to retain the colour from

tool.help:
**What it does**
CRISPRStudio is a program developed to facilitate and accelerate CRISPR array visualization. It works by first comparing spacers sequence homology in a dataset, then assigning a two-color-code to each cluster of spacers and finally writing an svg file, which can be opened in graphics vector editor.
